website_summaries.verdict: Nutritious and effective treats from a popular pet supply brand.
pros: Healthy treats that keep cats' mouths and teeth clean
The unique shape and texture reduces tarter, avoiding build-up
With lots of natural, healthy ingredients including vitamins, minerals, and taurine, the treats are perfect for lots of daily snacking
Pet owners say they keep their cats' breath fresher, too, and their cats love the taste
cons: Pricier since it is an all-natural option

customer_reviews.title: There are two styles of covers, one is great, one not so much..
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves these; However in the 11 oz size we note the picture of the cover isnt correct for all the flavors. On the savory salmon, our cover has a small lid one can flip up built into the green lid which is VERY NICE; However the 4 other flavors (did I mention our cat loves these things), have just a solid green cover; Which means to get some out one has to pry off the top and reach in to get a few out. (If one has arthritis getting the cover off can be an issue) We wish ALL the flavors came with the small flip up lid built into the larger lid...
customer_reviews.author: Jim NewHampshire

customer_reviews.title: Made my cat very sick...
customer_reviews.text: When these arrived, I gave my 10-pound cat just 3 to try. She ate them and walked away. Shortly thereafter she threw them up and for the next 12 hours had extremely bad diarrhea so I definitely will not be giving her any more. I purchased the large canisters on the recommendation of a couple friend who's cats love them, but for some reason, the item is not returnable so I guess I'll be donating them. Not happy an amazon choice product isn't returnable!! I don't see that information anywhere on the listing.
customer_reviews.author: ButterYum

customer_reviews.title: Won't Work for my cats.
customer_reviews.text: We have two Siamese cats. One is about 11 pounds and the other a little over 13 pounds. The larger cat would mouth these treats and spit it out. He just didn't like it. The smaller cat would pick up the treat and just swallow it without chewing it at all. This obviously will not help clean his teeth. The pieces are smaller than the Purina Dentalife dental treats that we are currently using. The Purina chews are more ball shaped whereas the Feline Greenies are sort of flat. For us this was a total bust. I will try returning these as they just can't be used.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Fixit

customer_reviews.title: WARNING TO ALL CAT OWNERS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This trash made my cat extremely constipated for almost a week straight. In our 6 years of having him, he has never fallen ill before but a couple handfuls of this garbage and that was all it took. After a very expensive trip to the vet he is okay (thank god) but we will never, EVER, be buying these horrible f***ing treats again.
customer_reviews.author: NoPantsMau5

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves them and great for his teeth. He loves the chicken flavor!
customer_reviews.text: These arrived yesterday. Somehow, our Frankie knew we had new treats! I opened the container and gave him two of them. I don't think I have ever seen a cat treat disappear that quickly! Frankie is about ten and we wanted to try him on the Greenies for cats. Have been giving Greenies to our dogs for about six months and really like how they help with doggie breath and keeping their teeth clean. Know they will do the same for Frankie. I highly recommend these treats for cats - especially if you give your cat canned food!
customer_reviews.author: Kayce Cawthon McCarty

customer_reviews.title: TWO TIMES IS NOT A CHARM!
customer_reviews.text: I ORDERED THESE (FROM AMAZON) IN THE PAST AT MY VET'S RECOMMENDATION -- NO PROBLEM. HOWEVER, THE LAST TWO ORDERS FROM AMAZON HAVE MADE BOTH MY CATS IMMEDIATELY ILL -- PROFUSE VOMITING! SOMETHING'S WRONG! (THE LAST BATCH HAD THE INNERSEAL ALREADY OPEN!) THERE HAVE BEEN NO DIET CHANGES TO EXPLAIN MY PETS REACTION.
customer_reviews.author: TX Shopper

customer_reviews.title: No different from grocery store garbage ingredients
customer_reviews.text: In fact my cat gets sick from them. My cat & my roommates like the taste but i won't buy again as they do not contain quality ingredients. Filler garbage. Much rather spend my $ on made in USA, quality ingredients rather than gluten, corn & the animal parts that should b disposed of, not fed to our furry friends. I recommend Sassycat freeze dried turkey, Cloud Star grain free buddy biscuits, Meowtinis, Purrfectly Natural freeze dried shrimp & beef lung too. Pet greens & Pure bites also. Don't waste your $ on Greenies.
customer_reviews.author: Venom Miss

customer_reviews.title: greenies my cat actually likes
customer_reviews.text: Mid-size crunchy dental treats. One of my middle-aged cats likes them quite a lot, the other can be coaxed to eat a couple. Neither one chews the treat more than a single crack (sometimes just swallowing them whole, less often cracking them twice), so I'm not sure how much it will help their teeth. They're harder than basic dry treats, but not rock-hard like some brands. Overall, I was happy to find "Greenies" they liked -- I've tried a couple of other varieties (including Greenies' hairball version) that they wouldn't touch. Also, chicken is the first ingredient, unlike a corn-forward brand I tried and discarded. Recommended for treats, but unclear on how well the dental aspect works.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Siddique

customer_reviews.title: Oven roasted chicken - cats’ favorite flavor
customer_reviews.text: All three cats like this particular flavor, they come running when they hear the rattle of this plastic box, or when someone loudly says “Greenies!”. There’s a former tropical street cat living indoors now who lost and/or broke a lot of teeth during his earlier hard life and the vet told me he had so many cavities. Poor little fellow also had several abscesses in his mouth about a year ago. Since that dental cleaning and a round of antibiotics this cat gets 2-3 Greenies 2-3 times/day, and his breath is good now, I don’t cringe when he yawns when he’s on my lap. Thank you, Greenies!
customer_reviews.author: Timbarina

customer_reviews.title: My Maine Coon Cat LOVES these treats!!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased different types of treats for my Maine Coon cat, but he without a doubt prefers the Greenies FELINE Dental Treats over any other treats. He likes the chicken and salmon about the same. Sometimes when we don't know where he is in the house we just have to say "Treats! Treats!" and he comes running from wherever he is so that he can have his treats. We love watching him eat them because he seems to really enjoy them!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Granville

customer_reviews.title: 5 for taste, 1 for health
customer_reviews.text: Really, I want to give this 2 reviews, a 5, and a 1. A 5 because my cat absolutely adored them. I didn't think he would, because they look like regular hard food, but he went crazy for them. The rating of 1 is because of the wheat in them. My 10 month-old cat ended up needing expensive veterinary care yesterday because he developed a ulcer on his mouth in reaction to the wheat in these treats. So beware that cats are not really meant to eat grains, and some of them react badly with allergic reactions.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea M. Pinto

customer_reviews.title: Cats get excited for these treats - however triggers my cats hyperesthesia syndrome
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. One will eat any treat you give her, the other is super picky. The super picky cat loves these treats. However, she also has feline hyperesthesia syndrome, and I don't know if she just gets over-excited about the treats or if there is something in the ingredients that doesn't agree with her, but she always has a hyperesthesia attack immediately after eating the treats and I had to stop using them. The other cat has no issues at all and loves these treats too.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Good for Kitty.!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves eating Greenies and she only like the chicken flavor,. They stay fresh in this container, but I don’t remove the whole plastic on top of the container, I just cut the corner where the tab is,. I get them every 2 months for her, it helps clean her teeth, but I also brush her teeth with a Toothette at least 3 times a week, she gets this once a day 3 to 5 pieces only, she doesn't have any stomach problems either.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ceron

customer_reviews.title: Cleans Kitties' teeth
customer_reviews.text: A truly great product. Our cat gobbles her Greenies with no reservation and wants more...(Which we do not give her any more than a serving.) Greenies are good at what they are advertised to do, which is to clean the teeth and get some chloraphyll into her system. Anyone who has ever tried to brush their cats' teeth know that Greenies is a better solution!
customer_reviews.author: dave brewer

customer_reviews.title: Good treat!
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE THESE. My Manx Captain Murphy is glad to do tricks for them! I was nervous at first because they're picky seniors. I haven't purposely smelled their breath yet... But sometimes, before these, I could often smell it anyhow. I switched to wet food so I'm hoping these take the stinky food smell away and clean their teeth some. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: SrvivlKittsn

customer_reviews.title: Greenies to the Rescue!
customer_reviews.text: My female kitty had dental issues caused primarily from too many human food treats like chicken, steak, tuna which all sound ok, but it turned out those foods caused her to eat less 'kibbles' designed to clean her teeth with their crunch. She developed periodontal disease and lost three teeth---sob!!! As she healed she become ever fussy about any food and we knew how essential it was that she have a proper amount of kibble like food. Greenies to the rescue!!! We mixed them in with her Science Diet Adult Oral Care kitty kibbles and voila' she now eats enough kibbles to keep her teeth clean :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why is this product still being sold?
customer_reviews.text: Our cat is currently very ill from eating these. Her symptoms are similar to those in some of the other one star reviews: crying, trying but unable to urinate, painful stools. With symptoms this serious, we don't understand why these "treats" are still on the market. Try Purina's DentaLife cat treats as a much better alternative.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: It's true what they say...
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended I steer clear of cat food products flavored with beef or sea food, so we went with the roasted chicken flavored treats. My latest deary, who is FIV+, needs lots of good nutrition and preventative care to keep infections and illnesses at bay. She also needs treats, no explanation necessary. We started with the 2.5 oz. pouch and that has lasted us about a week to 8 days. For her weight, I've been giving her at least 18 treats a day. Sometimes more, never less :)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: My cats demand these
customer_reviews.text: My cats line up eagerly at the same time every day, waiting for me to give them their Greenies treats. If I’m late, they pace around, yowling. They love these things! They’ve had every flavor, because I try to mix it up so they’re not getting the same thing every time, and they’ve never rejected any of them. These are the only treats they react this way to, and I’m happy to give it to them because Greenies are good for their teeth, and much healthier than the kitty junk food that the mainstream brands are peddling.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa

customer_reviews.title: Something is different with these.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been getting these in the smaller 5oz bags for my cats for years - they love them. I was so happy to see these bigger containers and immediately put them on Subscribe & Save... The cats turned their noses up at them! I don’t know if they aren’t as fresh, or how they are different, but the cats leave them on the floor. I do think they might look a little different - darker and smaller. It wasn’t a one off because I got three of them and the same result with each container. I canceled Subscribe & Save.
customer_reviews.author: MAR

customer_reviews.title: My neighbor's cat loved them
customer_reviews.text: I give these 4-stars with an explanation. My cats would not touch them. Hated them! (they also don't like most canned food or even regular tuna). They did that thing cats do where they try to bury something they find disgusting. So why on Earth would I give this 4-stars? Have I gone mental?! After my spoiled little felines absolutely refused to eat them I offered the container to a neighbor who has a cat... Her cat LOVED them. So much so that when they were placed in a bowl with her usual brand the cat ate these and left her usual brand behind. So it all comes down to the nature of cats. Some will like them, some won't.
customer_reviews.author: Frozen_Lizard

customer_reviews.title: Feline finicky finally satisfied plus...
customer_reviews.text: My finicky feline absolutely loves these! She looks for them alongside her wet food meals. Friendly, the finicky feline, has a shiny, soft coat now after only two weeks of being given her first chicken flavor Greenie. She had a bad case of dandruff but that has improved enormously. Her teeth are also whiter. I’ve tried other brands and wasted a lot of money. Now I’ve finally found a winner. I highly recommend it for any teen (6 months and older) and older cats. I think they are too large for kittens, however, you can break them up and serve smaller cats, too. It would keep the cat healthier while developing.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan

customer_reviews.title: Container Open
customer_reviews.text: The container of Greenies had been opened and about 1/3 of the contents was gone. There is a clear plastic seal around the lid that must be removed by hand, so there was human intervention here. I'm not going to use these with my cat because they may have been contaminated.
customer_reviews.author: Mary V

customer_reviews.title: Threw away!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love treats, except these. My older cat just looked at them and walked away. My younger cat couldn’t chew them, so he swallowed them whole. I ended up throwing them away.
customer_reviews.author: Razalas72

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves
customer_reviews.text: I try to look for treats that have chicken as the first ingredient, this one has chicken meal, which isn't as great as plain chicken , however my cat seems to like the flavor slightly better than other treats, so it'll stay in her rotation. I try to get the smaller size bags as she is picky on the freshness too . I'm not convinced on the dental part, however I do hear her crunch on it, vs some other treats that she just swallows whole.
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Picky Persian Loves This Kitty Crack
customer_reviews.text: My cat is the type of high-maintenance princess that would prefer to starve than deign to eat something she doesn't like the taste of. This stuff is literally kitty crack. They're so enticing that my parents essentially trained her to climb up her tall scratching post like a spider monkey to grab at them. (Shown above for your viewing pleasure) I take solace in the fact that they're supposedly helpful for her teeth because trying to brush them for her is a major struggle.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: loved by cats... and dogs
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these, my dogs love these. And I actually tried them and they're good. HA HA. I wouldn't order them at a restaurant but I can see why they like them: they're crunchy but they have a give so they're not solid and hard. Not soft, either. Little ridges to supposedly clean the teeth. If I lay out a bunch of dried cat food, they don't care; if I lay these out, they care. So I guess it's worth the extra few bucks to make them happy. :)
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Happy cat, healthy teeth!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these treats, they come in all kinds of great flavors for her...she gobbles them up and actually begs for them like a dog! To top it off they’re healthy and great to help with her teeth and gums! Highly recommend them! Try them in all flavors! Your cat will thank you, and so will her vet!
customer_reviews.author: Genine

customer_reviews.title: Great for picky eaters & sensitive tummies
customer_reviews.text: One of our cats has allergies, and another is a total food snob and so finding food and treats that work for them both is often challenging. These treats (as well as the catnip flavor) are one of the only ones that pleases them both and are also healthy (when used according to instructions, of course). They go crazy for the catnip and the chicken flavors, and it does help improve their breath over time.
customer_reviews.author: TiffanyTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: My cats are obsessed with these
customer_reviews.text: My cats have the tuna flavor of these. They absolutely love them. Even my older cat who is sort of picky almost likes them more than our younger cat! They are far more well received than any of the mainstream brands you find in the grocery store. My only complaint is the expiration date is only 30 days out from when I received them. I realize we don't need items that contain lots of preservatives, but for such a large quantity I would want them to have a better date.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Cat crack!
customer_reviews.text: My cats are 100% obsessed with these treats. They know where I keep them (I keep some in my room in a mason jar because anything else they’d be able to break into) and the rest of the container in a middle shelf in my kitchen cabinet. One of my cats has successfully broken into the treats MANY times but thankfully I’m always home to catch his insubordination. Bad cat. But would he be bad if not for the treats? We’ll never know. I can’t stop buying these because I’m pretty sure my cats will stage a coup the day I do.
customer_reviews.author: Maia V

customer_reviews.title: Great treats you can’t go wrong
customer_reviews.text: These treats always get the attention of my cats and dog. The container is nice and keeps them fresher than other products and is easier to manage than a plastic bag. It also makes a good rattle sound to call your pets when you shake it. Great value for the quantity at this price and my pets never got sick or had problems. after years of using this they still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Domino

customer_reviews.title: Krazee Kitty
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these treats. As soon as I rattle the container, her ears perk up and her eyes get wide & then she gobbles them up. My only complaint is that the lid doesn't have a flip top (as is shown in the photo, one corner of the lid has a flip top). A flip top lid makes it easier to pour out a few treats, rather than taking off the entire lid to access the treats. So, Greenies: PLEASE make a flip top lid for the 11oz container. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Cats love them
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased all kinds of treats for my 2 cats, these are the only ones they will both eat and they LOVE them. All I have to do is shake the bag and they both come running. I plan on trying some different flavors as well but I am so excited to finally find a treat that they think is a treat to get lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again!
customer_reviews.text: My cats are SUPER picky with what treats and what food they will eat. They do NOT care for soft treats, these are hard and crunchy and you can smell the flavor per opening the bag—so they’ve taken to this healthy transition well. So happy I’ve found a way to clean their teeth!
customer_reviews.author: kpcpfam

customer_reviews.title: A MIRACLE
customer_reviews.text: It seems that I have purchased every cat treat on the market for my Siamese cat, Pippa. I’ve given away or donated every brand I’ve ever bought. Feline GREENIES is the ONLY treat she will eat. Arrived yesterday. Let her sniff, and she walked away; I’m thinking here we go again! Left four out for her last night and much to my shock, they were GONE this morning. To prove to myself that I wasn’t hallucinating, I put out a few more this morning. GONE! Thank you, thank you, Greenies!
customer_reviews.author: Anne T. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Something was different about this batch
customer_reviews.text: Last time my cat love them like went crazy this time showed no interest but I did notice believe it or not was affect the color was a little different smell wise I don’t know because I didn’t smell the first batch but I know that my cat was not interested before she used to so I don’t know if they change the formula but she’s not interested in this one
customer_reviews.author: julie Deuel

customer_reviews.title: Shake the box and they come running!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love Feline Greenies! Shake the box and they come running. It has great vitamin content as well as the main purpose, cleaning their teeth and breath (?). Very good to use a treat, a reward, or alternative to brushing (when combined with occasional vet appts to clean teeth) for cats who cannot tolerate a brush in their mouth. My cats also never throw up from this stuff, but I have had a cat throw up temptations treats once because of eating a few too many.
customer_reviews.author: Michael in Boston

customer_reviews.title: Cats beg for them!
customer_reviews.text: Two of my three cats LOVE these treats. And fortunately, these are the two with dental issues. I don't know if the Greenies really make a difference when it comes to their oral health, but it's worth a shot! They beg for the treats, and they definitely recognize the word "Greenies" :-) As these are only slightly more expensive than the non-dental treats I had been buying, I'll keep getting these.
customer_reviews.author: Becky R.

customer_reviews.title: Happy hairy little bum lickers
customer_reviews.text: Our girl is an addict! Thanks to the “crinkle” sound greenies bags make any snack bag must now bear a thorough inspection before we can enjoy it. The rattle of the greenies tub is now like a dinner bell and the cats will come from over the hill. Do they make their breath fresh... does it matter when they kick their own butts? Cats like it and happy cat equals happy home.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdasaurus Rex

customer_reviews.title: Cats go bonkers for these, they must be delicious!
customer_reviews.text: my cats love these, but as for reviewing " freshness " and " flavor" I wouldn't know, Ive never tasted them! But considering how my cats go bonkers when I shake the container, and practically climb up my legs to get these treats, Im going to assume the freshness and flavor are good! Big container is better deal then pets shops too.
customer_reviews.author: SooZeeQ

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I’d never read the suggested servings before, so I’m really glad that I read the detailed info on this. I was worried that there was going to be too much in this container, but now that I see the suggested servings, I am so happy to have such a big container!! This way I’m not worried about running out, because this size container for the price is a steal. Happy customer here!!
customer_reviews.author: Sonja Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Our cat goes nuts for these!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat SERIOUSLY loves the chicken flavor Greenies. Also, it makes me feel good giving him a treat that keep his teeth and gums healthy. Although don't use these as a substitute for getting your animal's teeth cleaned, you still need to have your vet check their teeth and gums regularly, and have them properly cleaned by them when necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Meegan

customer_reviews.title: LOL
customer_reviews.text: Taste and freshness, my cat won't say and I didn't eat one to see! Gabby wasn't sure about them at first but she seems to like them. I was looking for something that helps dental, and reward for obeying...LOL I know a cat "obey", but she does seem trainable on certain things.
customer_reviews.author: OregonNative

customer_reviews.title: Picky Cat Loves These!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a very picky eater and it's hard to find treats he likes but he loves these! They don't upset his digestion, unlike other treats. I feed him 5 treats per day and he weighs 11 lbs. They treats do make him thirsty right after he eats them so I like to have fresh water available for him near where he eats them.
customer_reviews.author: The Boobazu

customer_reviews.title: Better than temptations for my finicky cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat was a temptations freak, until he tried these. Now he literally TURNS UP HIS NOSE at the temptations and will ONLY eat these. That's huge, considering how he used to run his body against the temptation bag while begging loudly. Cat approved, from my very finicky guy. It's a little healthier too.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Buy small package
customer_reviews.text: Well my cats do not like these treats , do not know if these treats are chewy or soft , but my cats did not like these. The outer seal around container was intact , but the inner seal was not sealed at all and the treats seems dry very crunchy. Now realize I bought the big container maybe should have bought the small packet which with most companies seem to stay fresh longer.
customer_reviews.author: rcmiller

customer_reviews.title: Cats vomiting
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed my cats were loving these. I mean they were excited for these treats the second time. But after 3 hours, they both simultaneously started vomiting. My cats have never done that before. After waiting for the next day, I fed them their food without the treats and they were fine. 24 hours later and still no vomit. I looked into the ingredients and have now noticed wheat and grains. My cats can't really stomach the stuff. So please be aware, if your cat cannot handle grains, this is not it chief.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: My Maine Coon with dental problems loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Although my Maine Coon is only 4 years old, she's already had 45% of her teeth removed. She didn't care for the prescription diet made for dental problems, but she loves these treats. She still needs a dental done at the vet's office yearly but I'm hoping these treats will help somewhat. I give her around 10-15 treats per day. No tummy upset. These treats have the VOHC approval for tartar control, while the prescription diet dental food has the VOHC approval for tarter and plaque.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho Libra

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Loved It
customer_reviews.text: But she is 10 and before I adopted her, her mouth was neglected. After the vet treated her mouth—and $1,500 later!—she cannot chew the Greenies because the vet had to remove some of her teeth 😔 Moral of the story is: take care of your cat’s mouth and feed her Greenies so her/his mouth will stay healthy!
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lover

customer_reviews.title: Cats love them
customer_reviews.text: I say the flavor is good, but I don't know this personally! However, the cats get enthusiastic about them, so I'm making assumptions here.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. R

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: The lid broke really easily. I’m not really sure how I’m supposed to be rating the flavor as it’s for cats but I will say my cats like the flavor? They provide quite a few bites in a box so I think it has good value for its price. I do think it recommends a large serving size per day.
customer_reviews.author: H. A. E.

customer_reviews.title: Very sick cats
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my cat, and split half the container to share with my sister’s cat. My cat had intense diarrhea and vomiting for 3 days, but I couldn’t figure out the cause of it. A week and a half later when she was feeling better, I gave her the treats again. She vomited and had diarrhea the next day. My sister said her cat had the same symptoms. Both cats were incredibly ill. Since they don’t eat the same food, the only correlation were the treats. Unfortunately, the order must have been a bad batch. This was completely worriesome especially since we couldn’t take the cats to the vet during quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My super finicky cats ADORE these!
customer_reviews.text: ONLY treat my cats will touch. Even the super finicky one LOVES these. And extra bonus that they are good for their teeth!! Wouldn't give more than 1-2 at once as I think tough on their tummies, but they would eat the whole tub if I let them, and these guys even snub all wet foods. Win-win. Not cheap, but I figure it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Tree Brosnan

customer_reviews.title: Makes Dental Health Fun
customer_reviews.text: Cat goes absolutely nuts for them. He usually got excited at the sound of a treat bag, but he went crazier than normal after sniffing it. He's willing to do some simple tricks and exercise for me just to get them. So far he's good at spinning in a circle following the food and jumping up to places like boxes I set a treat down.
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Made my cats throw up
customer_reviews.text: My 3 cats liked these just fine, but the second time that 2 of them threw up right after eating a few, I threw away the container. One of my cats throws up hairballs a lot, but the other 2 almost never throw up unless they've eaten something upsetting, like plant matter.
customer_reviews.author: C. Myers

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Loves Them!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t usually give my cat treats all that often but till I found these Greenies whom I’ve heard all about. My cats breath has smelled 10x times better! And her teeth look much cleaner. I still recommend you take your cat to a vet yearly and get them a teeth cleaning every few years cause it’s best to stay safe than sorry. Did I also mention my cat loves them??? She does!!
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Cats love greenies, but do they really contribute to dental health?
customer_reviews.text: All three of the kitties I know go crazy for Greenies Dental Treats. However, do they really contribute much to the cat's dental health? Not everyone thinks so: "Dental treats such as Greenies are simply dry food in disguise, and won’t do anything to prevent plaque. The chlorophyll added to some of these treats may help your cat’s breath smell better, but this may mask more serious health problems." Read the full article at [...] Four stars because, considered just as a treat, you could do far worse. My cat is particular about treats: likes crunchy ones a lot more than the soft ones, and among those Greenies are her favorite.
customer_reviews.author: UnseenWorld

customer_reviews.title: Cat gets sick, I'm throwing them away.
customer_reviews.text: Update my review. My poor cat pukes after eating these. It's happened twice now, I thought it was a coincidence at first. But it's not. It's usually within 10 mins or giving her these. She is a healthy cat so it is concerning. do NOT give these to your animal. Something is very wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these treats
customer_reviews.text: My cats loves them. Most cats can open the container by knocking it over. Many cats, including mine, can open the cabinet to jump in and knock them down. This last pack is an ounce less for the same price. But I still buy them because the kitties love them. They do last pretty long, being used just as an extra treat. I don’t know if they really help teeth. That was one reason for selecting this brand the first time. Their teeth are good though. The hard chewing likely even helps.
customer_reviews.author: FuchsiaLady

customer_reviews.title: Kozmo, Wolfgang and Juno love them!
customer_reviews.text: My cats lurk around the kitchen when they know treat time is coming. I give them twice a day. They love these little treats, and my dog does too. I I want them all to come running, all I have to do is shake the box! I hope they help with their dental health as we have to get them both teeth cleaning each year and that costs an arm and a leg. I will report back after their check-up!
customer_reviews.author: Snowbrocade

customer_reviews.title: REALLY Good Treat
customer_reviews.text: These treats are good, but somewhat expensive. Our one cat absolutely loves them, but the other loved them at first and now she doesn’t seem to be interested in them. We haven’t had their teeth checked since purchasing these treats, so can’t comment on the cleaning properties.
customer_reviews.author: TweetyChick03

customer_reviews.title: Misleading product
customer_reviews.text: My cats love the taste, but their breath still smells horrendous. So this product did not work for what it claims to work for
customer_reviews.author: Heather Robinson

customer_reviews.title: My 5 month old Ragdoll loved them!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about feeding this to my cat. I had a Persian before and they weren't as picky as my ragdoll. I was amazed that he is in love with them. As soon as he sees the box or hears it, even if he is asleep, he will wake up and come for a treat. He keeps meowing and following me until he receives his treat. I ordered the chicken flavor and give about 6-10 treats per day because he is only 5 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Khanam

customer_reviews.title: Cats hate it
customer_reviews.text: My cats would not eat these at all. I had some of them vomit after eating them too. Not sure what’s in them or why they just don’t seem appetizing but not worth the money. I love greenies brands too for pups but it just doesn’t work for cats
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat says they are meowy good! Lol
customer_reviews.text: My picky cat loves these....she will sit in my lap and stare at me.... I know what she wants... her treats...she never acted like this about a treat before. Cats love these...I accidently tasted them YUKKY, Blah...but the cat begs for them.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper girl

customer_reviews.title: Decent size for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought a smaller bag of the Greenies cat treats when I first got my kitten. I haven't had her for two months yet so I haven't quite gotten through the bag I can have. She seems to really like them and it comes with quite a lot in a bag. That being said of haven't needed to open the bin yet so I will update when I do. I can't see there being an issue with it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Meh. Gotta trick my cat to eat them.
customer_reviews.text: My last cat loved these. But my new cat does not. The last cat was old and had no teeth but could somehow eat these crunchy treats. The new cat doesn't really like them, even though she's 4 and has all of her teeth. I have to hide them inside of her food in order to get her to eat them. She likes other crunchy treats just fine. Update April 2020 My fat cat loves these! So its really just a matter of preference. She doesn't normally like cat nip products, but likes these.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Van Eycke

customer_reviews.title: Unflavored treats
customer_reviews.text: My cat turned her nose up at these and I couldn’t understand why as she has eaten them before. I realized that they don’t really have a specific flavor like her other ones did. I think they were labeled chicken flavored. These don’t say. My dogs will eat them for treats, but I’ll make sure to check for flavor next time!
customer_reviews.author: Amma

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that they no longer have the easy-open corner
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that they no longer have the easy-open corner. The package still has the green-triangle on the lid, but there is no longer a pull-tab lid. The last 3 times I ordered, you have to remove the entire lid.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Melim

customer_reviews.title: Two flavors tried, cats loved both, and you can hear the teeth working.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a cat treat I expect is cleaning teeth and which all 3 cats seem to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon D Leszczynski

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t really help with bad breath
customer_reviews.text: Our cat did not eat them at all at first. However, after we’ve tried buying different flavors, we’ve noticed that he will Occasionally eat salmon flavored treats. It doesn’t do any wonders in regards to the bad breath, only helps improve it a tiny bit. Overall, we’ll shop around for other options on the market
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: My Kitty Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves these. I gave them 5 stars for flavor although I've never tasted them but every time I give them to my cat he eats them right away, so they must be good. They come fresh and the large size container lasts for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie L. Waidler

customer_reviews.title: Trust Me, I'm Not Eating These!!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats told me to tell you that they appreciate getting these from me every morning when I leave for work. They like the crunch and indicated that they taste good as they gobble them up! They hate the begging thing but do it anyway. So, I don't know how they taste or if they're fresh because I'd have to eat one to know or would I know even if I tried one? Hmmmm...
customer_reviews.author: DJZB

customer_reviews.title: Cats love these
customer_reviews.text: Crack for cats, you can get your cats to do anything for these. I wish I could use these on my good-for-nothing - sons to get them to clean their rooms, shower, or just act like humans in general.
customer_reviews.author: Sad Hubby

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes these treats. I actually mix them ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes these treats. I actually mix them with their food or sometimes give it by itself. Either way, the cat loves it. Handy size but the last two that I ordered through Amazon did not have a hole in the lid, as it advertised with “easy opening.” This would require you to find another canister, to open the entire lid, or find one that does have a proper lid and than use that one.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Serene

customer_reviews.title: ... a dental because she's a slob and wasn't maintaining good oral hygiene
customer_reviews.text: My fat cat needed a dental because she's a slob and wasn't maintaining good oral hygiene... The dentist recommended these after, to avoid more plaque and better overall oral health moving forward and the price was right so I have it a whirl. They are sort of hard, and I may have introduced them to said fat cat too soon after her dental with her tender mouth, because she loved them initially but she isn't a super fan of them anymore. That being said I mix them in with her dry food and she sucks them down like a Hoover vacuum. So far, so good as far as dental health. Will continue use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: My kitten absolutely loves these. I was buying different tests at first. After a recent trip to the vet and then giving her one to try she is addicted! I love the fact that these help clean tartar off the teeth and have a flavor to them as well. She is tiny and gobbles these up fairly well with no issues. The pack comes sealed very well and the canister it comes in can be reused. Greenies are a great treat to add to any cat or kittens daily intake!
customer_reviews.author: Aubsmommmy

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is not the super value size! That one is 21 oz, this is only 11 oz for the same price. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Fortune

customer_reviews.title: My cats LOVE these
customer_reviews.text: I stopped buying these for awhile because one of my cats is allergic to some of the ingredients, but jut bought some and my other cats who are allowed to have them went nuts. They can't get enough of them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Best healthy Cat treats.. MY 2 cats Eat them up!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: get these for your kitties...as they are so good for their teeth...the container is great and reusable..My husband saves containers for Things in the garage or his SHED. Great Flavors.. GOOD PURCHASE>.Fair PRICE>
customer_reviews.author: SUSANDP

customer_reviews.title: Selective cat likes
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 15 yr old cat. Had tried a long time ago but didn't go over well. Now.......great. She is eating these and likes. I think it's good for her teeth. Dogs get similar greenie type treats and vet noticed a difference. So, happy that ol' Bailey likes.
customer_reviews.author: R BTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Made my cat very ill.
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived, the container had cracked and almost all of the treats were loose in the bag. My cats have gone for any treat I have ever given them with no hesitation, and they flat out rejected these. One of my cats actually ate one, and has been throwing up ever since. I would never recommend these to anyone!! Huge disappointment!!
customer_reviews.author: Audreylover92

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in damaged container twice.
customer_reviews.text: Product was great but I added it to my subscribe and save. Out of three times it has been delivered two of the containers had a damaged lid and both times the treats were all emptied in the box. Once they fell out of the box on the floor. The next time I saw the empty container and was able to keep it from spilling out. If this happens again I will cancel and get elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Mansbach

customer_reviews.title: She like them.
customer_reviews.text: My cat is so picky. But she loves these dental treats, plus they keep her teeth healthy. I give her a small bunch every morning on top of her dry food. She eats them and leaves the rest of the food. It's been hard to find anything she likes. So I finally just give her the best for her and when she's hungry enough she'll eat.
customer_reviews.author: Pat C

customer_reviews.title: NO dental cleaning:(
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these things. The only problem is that my cat eats these so fast that she just swallows the nuggets whole - no chewing, ever! Doesn't that defeat the idea of dental cleaning? Well, 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Balu

customer_reviews.title: My kitties love greenies
customer_reviews.text: Treats treats treats and more treats with benefits. Greenies for kitties make my cats smile. They help with bad breath and there is something about them that encourage my cat who doesnt chew anything to crunch them right up.
customer_reviews.author: Alley Wishes

customer_reviews.title: My cat turned up her nose
customer_reviews.text: These appear to be the same product in stores but my cat licks them and walks away. Maybe they were stored in too hot of a location? Also, the 'best by' date was only a few months away from delivery (delivered in July, past sell by date mid September).
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: My kitten loves these
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! I don't know if it's really protecting his teeth, but he loves these! I use them as treats for rewarding and training (I don't give him too many) but he goes crazy for them. There is also a ton in the container, it will last me a while!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Ward

customer_reviews.title: My cats love these
customer_reviews.text: I have very finicky cats and I wasn't sure they would like them as they didn't like other dental treats I had given them . They also work very very well. My cats teeth are very clean and no tartar .
customer_reviews.author: AzDesertRose

customer_reviews.title: Value pretty good, best to store in another air tight container for maximum freshness and shelf life
customer_reviews.text: 8 month old kittens love em, they clean their teeth with this before bed. Price is good but could be better. To keep them freshest, best to store in a more air tight container as it looks like the original container purposefully doesn’t seal 100%
customer_reviews.author: Robert215

customer_reviews.title: Cats love them
customer_reviews.text: My cats love greenies dental treats, but one of our cats has a food allergy we're trying to pin down and every flavor of these has chicken meal in it. Hopefully chicken isn't his allergy or we'll have to figure something else out!
customer_reviews.author: J review

customer_reviews.title: Change the recipe back!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these for a year and my cats adored them like crack lol! They would jump all over me to get to them until the last two times I bought them. I even got different flavors. Did you change the recipe or something? I have 4 bags and 2 containers of treats that will be wasted because they won't eat them.
customer_reviews.author: cheri

customer_reviews.title: Good for teeth
customer_reviews.text: Only treats my cats will eat, they both have clean teeth and no bad breath
customer_reviews.author: cat lady

customer_reviews.title: This is my cat's cocaine
customer_reviews.text: We call it her "kitty crack". I shake the thing and she stops what she's doing and devours them. Not sure they actually help with her teeth health ...but I'd like to think they do? She's a little kitty (6 lbs), though, so these are almost too big for her mouth
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats not interested
customer_reviews.text: Trying to wean my cats off Temptations. They ate these a couple of times and now ignore them =/. The treats have much better ingredients, I'm hoping as time passes they will come around to these.
customer_reviews.author: CthuLuke

customer_reviews.title: A Cat Favorite in Our House
customer_reviews.text: I can't judge freshness myself but my two cats go crazy for these. I bought a small pack initially and it was a hit so I purchased the large container. I give them a few for their bedtime treats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Addicted
customer_reviews.text: Tried these for the first time and #TayoTheCat is literally addicted to them. He climbed the shelf to rip the box down 3 times and spilled them all over the floor. Top lid isn't very secure. Plastic is a bit thin. Otherwise, he's clearly obsessed with these! – DJ AFINO
customer_reviews.author: DJ AFINO

customer_reviews.title: Evidently they are kitty-crack
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves these... more so that other treat brands. Like REALLY more than any other brand. The breath freshening doesn't seem to be that much but she has some pretty stinky breath. Good enough as a snack though although we may cut them out if we catch her smoking them.
customer_reviews.author: pagerage

customer_reviews.title: My cats love them and I'm hopeful it will help with their stinky breath!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these treats! They drive me crazy begging for them. So just be prepared to be endlessly hassled by your kitties. Better price than I can find them in the store. My cats give these treats two paws up!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie C

product_meta.title: FELINE GREENIES Natural Dental Care Cat Treats, Chicken Flavor, All Bag Sizes
product_meta.description: Size:11 oz.| Color:ChickenFELINE GREENIES Oven Roasted Chicken Flavor Dental Cat Treats were designed to help keep your cat’s mouth clean and healthy. With their unique shape and crunchy texture, these treats are proven to clean teeth and reduce tartar. Plus, these irresistible little cat chews also work to freshen cat breath, letting you both enjoy cuddle time even more. But because these natural cat treats have added vitamins, minerals, and taurine, they do more than just offer cat teeth care… they offer complete, tasty nutrition, too. As the #1 vet-recommended feline dental treat,* FELINE GREENIES are the healthy, low-calorie cat teeth cleaning treats you’ve been looking for. Give your cat FELINE GREENIES Dental Treats and you’re sure to stir up fresh, healthy, happy purrs of joy. FELINE GREENIES: for healthy and happy dental and oral care. * Among U.S. veterinarians who recommend dental treats for at-home oral care.
feature_bullets: Contains one (1) 11 oz. tub of FELINE Greenies Crunchy Natural Dental Treats in Oven Roasted Chicken Flavor; Natural Cat Treats Plus Vitamins, Minerals, and Other Nutrients
Crunchy texture and unique shape clean teeth and reduce tartar, while also serving as a cat breath freshener
Natural formula with added vitamins, minerals, and taurine to offer complete nutrition, along with optimal dental care
These cat snacks are proudly made in the USA, with quality ingredients sourced from around the world
Included Components: Feline Greenies Dental Treats Oven Roasted Chicken Flavor 11 Ounces

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
